ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.filters

Class CustomKPIFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.KPIManager
      • ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.filters.CustomKPIFilter

  • public class CustomKPIFilter
extends KPIManager
    Author:
    Armando Varriale

    This class is an implementation of a "Custom KPI Filter". It extends the KPIManager abstract class by adding some specific aspects and provide an adequate implementation of the "launch()" method.

    This class let you to create a custom KPI filter, using a XML file for filter specification.

    In particular you must provide a set of parameters like the custom filter name, the event name to which the filter must be applied, the publication ID and the subscription IDs, and finally the EPL queries (at least one) that realize the filtration task.
    For a more detailed presentation of these concepts, the creation and the relative usage of a custom filter, see the provided tutorials section of the ECoWare documentation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomKPIFilter

        public CustomKPIFilter(Element xmlElement,
               String busServer,
               com.espertech.esper.client.Configuration esperConfiguration)
                throws Exception
        Constructs a new CustomKPIFilter using the specified XML element. The bus server name (that is the hostname on which the bus server is running) and Esper configuration are also required.
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - the XML element (node) of the configuration file from which retrieve the information to build the KPI object
        busServer - the hostname on which the bus server is running
        esperConfiguration - the Esper current configuration (that is an Configuration object. For further detail see the Esper documentation).
        Throws:
        Exception

        Description copied from class: KPIManager
        This method actually starts the KPI processing.
        This is an abstract method that all classes that extend KPIManager must implement.
